definitions: small thin sharp piece broken or cut from something larger
examples: A sliver of glass stuck in her finger
He removed the wooden sliver with tweezers carefully

definitions: short memorable phrase used in advertising or political campaigns
examples: The company's slogan appeared on every product label
Political candidates often repeat their campaign slogan frequently

definitions: waste food mixed with liquid fed to animals
liquid carelessly spilled or splashed
examples: The farmer poured slop into the pig trough
Kitchen slop covered the dirty floor completely
She wiped the slop from the table quickly
Coffee slop stained his white shirt badly

definitions: narrow opening or groove for inserting something
allocated time period or position in a schedule
examples: Insert the coin into the slot carefully
The mail slot in the door needs fixing
She booked a morning slot for her appointment
The TV show moved to a prime-time slot

definitions: tree-dwelling mammal native to Central and South America
habitual disinclination to exertion or extreme laziness
examples: The sloth hung from the tree branch peacefully
Baby sloths learn to climb very slowly
His sloth prevented him from achieving his goals
Workplace sloth can lead to termination quickly

definitions: decrease in speed, activity, or rate of production
examples: The economic slowdown affected many businesses severely
Traffic slowdown caused delays during rush hour

definitions: act or process of becoming slower or less active
examples: The slowing of the economy worried investors greatly
Gradual slowing of heart rate indicates relaxation

definitions: thick muddy or semi-liquid substance produced by sewage treatment
examples: Toxic sludge contaminated the river water dangerously
Workers removed sludge from the treatment tank

definitions: soft-bodied mollusk similar to a snail without shell
solid projectile fired from a gun or air rifle
examples: Garden slugs damaged the lettuce plants overnight
The slug left a shiny trail behind
Police found the slug embedded in the wall
Shotgun slugs are used for hunting large game

definitions: baseball player known for hitting with great power
examples: The slugger hit three home runs last night
Young sluggers practice their swing technique daily

definitions: densely populated urban area characterized by poor housing conditions
examples: The slum lacked basic sanitation and clean water
Government programs aim to improve slum conditions

definitions: state of sleeping peacefully or period of sleep
examples: The baby's slumber lasted through the entire night
Gentle music helped her drift into peaceful slumber

definitions: sudden severe or prolonged fall in price or value
drooping or slouching position of the body
examples: The stock market slump worried investors worldwide
Housing prices recovered after the recent slump
His slump at the desk showed extreme fatigue
Poor posture created an unhealthy slump

definitions: derogatory or insulting remark about a group
indistinct pronunciation of words running together
examples: Racial slurs have no place in civilized society
The slur hurt her feelings deeply
His slur made it hard to understand him
Alcohol caused a noticeable slur in speech

definitions: partially melted snow or ice mixed with water
examples: Cars splashed through slush on the city streets
Gray slush accumulated along the sidewalk edges

definitions: offensive term historically used to shame women
examples: Using such derogatory terms reflects poor character
The word has a long history of harmful usage

definitions: sharp slap or blow with the palm
loud sound made by pressing lips together
examples: The smack echoed through the quiet room
A smack on the wrist taught him a lesson
She gave him a smack on the cheek
The smack of her lips showed enjoyment

definitions: highly contagious viral disease characterized by fever and pustules
examples: Smallpox vaccination eliminated the disease globally by 1980
Historical smallpox epidemics killed millions of people worldwide

definitions: mobile phone with advanced computing capabilities and internet connectivity
examples: Her smartphone contains all her important contacts
Modern smartphones replace many traditional devices effectively

definitions: act of breaking something violently into pieces
overwhelming success in entertainment or business
examples: The smash of glass startled everyone nearby
The car smash damaged both vehicles severely
The movie became a box office smash
Her first novel was an unexpected smash

definitions: act of breaking something into pieces forcefully
extremely good or impressive in British informal usage
examples: The smashing of windows alerted the neighbors
Plate smashing is part of Greek celebrations
They had a smashing time at the party
The performance received smashing reviews everywhere

definitions: slight superficial knowledge or small amount of something
examples: She has a smattering of French vocabulary
A smattering of applause followed the speech

definitions: greasy or sticky mark made by rubbing
false accusation intended to damage someone's reputation
examples: The smear on the window blocked the view
Jam smears covered the child's face completely
The political smear damaged his campaign significantly
Media smears can destroy careers unfairly

definitions: act of perceiving odors through the nose
examples: The smelling of fresh bread made everyone hungry
Dogs excel at smelling hidden substances

definitions: simple drawing or emoticon representing a smiling face
examples: She added a smiley to her text message
The yellow smiley became an iconic symbol

definitions: act of forming a smile to express happiness
examples: Her constant smiling brightened everyone's day
Smiling releases endorphins in the brain

definitions: person who works with metal especially by forging
examples: The village smith repaired farming tools regularly
Medieval smiths created armor and weapons

definitions: workshop where a blacksmith works with metal
examples: The old smithy still contains original equipment
Smoke rose from the smithy's chimney daily

definitions: loose dress or protective garment worn over clothes
examples: The artist wore a smock to protect her clothes
Children's smocks kept their uniforms clean

definitions: fog mixed with smoke and other atmospheric pollutants
examples: Thick smog reduced visibility in the city
Industrial smog poses serious health risks

definitions: building where meat or fish is cured with smoke
examples: The smokehouse produced delicious smoked salmon
Traditional smokehouses use specific wood types

definitions: person who regularly smokes tobacco products
device or appliance used for smoking food
examples: The smoker stepped outside during break time
Heavy smokers face increased health risks
The barbecue smoker cooked meat slowly overnight
Electric smokers maintain consistent temperature easily

definitions: cloud of smoke created to conceal military operations
action or statement intended to disguise real intentions
examples: Military units deployed a smokescreen during retreat
The smokescreen hid the advancing troops effectively
His promises were just a smokescreen for corruption
The company used a smokescreen to hide losses

definitions: tall chimney that carries smoke away from factories
examples: The factory's smokestack towered above nearby buildings
Old smokestacks mark the industrial district

definitions: act or practice of inhaling and exhaling tobacco smoke
examples: Smoking causes numerous health problems over time
Public smoking bans protect non-smokers from exposure

definitions: thick beverage made from blended fruits or vegetables
examples: She made a strawberry smoothie for breakfast
Green smoothies contain nutritious leafy vegetables

definitions: dirty mark or smear made by rubbing
examples: Ink smudges covered the important document unfortunately
The smudge on her face revealed chocolate eating

definitions: person who illegally transports goods across borders
examples: Border patrol caught the smuggler with contraband
Historical smugglers avoided high import taxes

definitions: illegal movement of goods or people across borders
examples: Drug smuggling remains a serious international problem
Smuggling operations use increasingly sophisticated methods

definitions: fungal disease affecting cereal crops
obscene or indecent talk, writing, or pictures
examples: Wheat smut reduced the harvest yield significantly
Farmers treat seeds to prevent smut infection
The bookstore refused to sell such smut
Internet filters block smut from children's access

definitions: small amount of food eaten between regular meals
examples: She packed healthy snacks for the long trip
Afternoon snacks help maintain energy levels

definitions: unexpected problem or drawback in a plan
sharp or rough projection that catches things
examples: We hit a snag in the construction project
Budget snags delayed the product launch significantly
Her sweater caught on a snag and tore
Tree snags provide habitat for wildlife

definitions: gastropod mollusk with a spiral shell and muscular foot
examples: Garden snails leave silvery trails behind them
The snail retreated into its shell quickly

definitions: wound resulting from the bite of a snake
examples: The snakebite required immediate medical attention urgently
Antivenom treats dangerous snakebite cases effectively

definitions: garden plant with flowers resembling a dragon's mouth
examples: Colorful snapdragons brightened the flower bed beautifully
Children enjoy making snapdragon flowers talk

definitions: marine fish valued as food especially red snapper
turtle with powerful jaws that snap when threatened
examples: Fresh red snapper tastes delicious when grilled properly
Commercial snapper fishing supports coastal economies
The snapping turtle's bite can break bones
Snapper turtles live in freshwater habitats

definitions: informal photograph taken quickly without elaborate preparation
brief summary or representation of something at a particular time
examples: Family snapshots filled the old photo album
She took snapshots during their vacation trip
The report provides a snapshot of current conditions
Financial snapshots help track business performance
